2.8.19  11:53 pm   I think a lot about your music, and what it means. A lot of people say there's some kind of deeper metaphor to it, other people say that it's meaningless. I think neither is very true, I've come to the conclusion that your music is about finding meaning in otherwise mundane things, rather than the mundane things themselves being metaphors, or just being meaningless. Would you agree with this at all?

2.8.19  8:48 pm   Hi Bill. I saw a video about Disclosure's song "Latch" where it said the song was in Bb dorian and went i > v > IV > III. Someone in the comments said no, it's clearly in Ab major and goes ii > vi > V > IV. Someone else said no, it's in F minor and goes iv > i > VII > VI. It was all a bit silly and it made me wonder if I should just analyze all songs in a major key even if they're minor or another mode. E.g. it seems a lot easier to just remember that vi > IV sounds cool rather than remembering both vi > IV and i > VI since they are the same notes. Do you see any downsides in only thinking about chords from an "ionian perspective"? (this might be a cool math rock band name) Or are there benefits in calling the vi chord the i chord if the song is in a minor key?
